Kimberly_Perry:
{{short description|American musician (born 1983)}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Kimberly Perry | image = File:The Band Perry 2013 (cropped).jpg | caption = Kimberly Perry performing with The Band Perry in 2013. | alt = Singer Kimberly Perry, singing into a microphone. | image_size = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Kimberly Marie Perry | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1983|07|12}} | origin = [[Jackson, Mississippi]], United States | instrument = Vocals, guitar | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 2005â€“present | label = Records/[[Columbia Records|Columbia]] | past_member_of = [[The Band Perry]] | website = }} '''Kimberly Marie Perry''' (born July 12, 1983) is an American [[country music]] singer-songwriter best known as a member of [[The Band Perry]] alongside her brothers Neil and Reid. The group signed to [[Republic Nashville]] in 2009 and released two studio albums with the label, achieving three number one singles on the [[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] [[Hot Country Songs]] chart, as well as three additional top ten singles. As a member of the band, Perry received a [[Grammy Award]], three [[Country Music Association Awards]] and four [[Academy of Country Music Awards]]. The band transitioned to pop in 2017 and attained limited success before officially announcing a hiatus in 2023. Following this, Kimberly returned to her country roots and launched a career as a solo artist. ==Career== ===Beginnings=== Perry sang in her own band as a teenager with her brothers Neil and Reid working as roadies and eventually as her opening act.{{Cite web |url=http://www.recordnet.com/article/20150806/ENTERTAINMENTLIFE/150809807 |title=Family ties keep The Band Perry on road to success |last=Sauro |first=Tony |date=6 August 2015 |publisher=Recordnet.com |access-date=11 February 2017}} Kimberly released an EP entitled "Carry On" with a song of the same name inspiring two songs on "Pioneer". Once they had united to form as "the Band Perry", they joined a New Faces of Country tour in 2005.{{Cite web |url={{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p2075800/biography|pure_url=yes}} |title=The Band Perry biography |last=Leggett |first=Steve |publisher=Allmusic |access-date=July 19, 2010}}{{cite news|last=Cox|first=Joanie|title=The Band Perry's sibling harmony|url=http://www.sun-sentinel.com/citylink/sfl-the-band-perrys-sibling-harmon-01262011,0,2592823.story|access-date=2012-08-25|newspaper=[[South Florida Sun-Sentinel]]|date=2011-01-25}} ===The Band Perry=== In 2008, they were discovered by [[Garth Brooks]]' manager Bob Doyle, who helped them make recordings that were sent to [[Scott Borchetta]], head of the newly established [[Republic Nashville]] label and were subsequently signed the following year, releasing their debut single "[[Hip to My Heart]]" in November 2009.{{Cite web |url=http://www.musicrow.com/2009/08/republic-nashville-signs-the-band-perry/ |title=Republic Nashville Signs The Band Perry |last=Ross |first=David M. |date=August 17, 2009 |website=Music Row |access-date=July 19, 2010}} Their five track [[The Band Perry (EP)|self-tiled extended play]] was released on April 6, 2010 and was later expanded into their [[The Band Perry (album)|debut album]], which was released on October 12 that same year. The album included "Hip to My Heart", which reached number 20 on the [[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] [[Hot Country Songs]] chart, and four additional singles which all reached the top 10. The album's second single "[[If I Die Young]]", was a breakthrough for the band, becoming their first number one and being certified 6x [[RIAA certification|platinum]] and sold 1.6 million copies.{{Cite magazine |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/7368134/the-band-perry-signs-interscope-records |title=The Band Perry Signs New Label Deal: Source |last=Newman |first=Melinda |date=12 May 2016 |magazine=Billboard |access-date=11 February 2017}} The band subsequently won the [[Country Music Association Award for New Artist of the Year]] and [[Country Music Association Award for Single of the Year|Single of the Year]], with Kimberly, the sole writer of "If I Die Young", also winning [[Country Music Association Award for Song of the Year|Song of the Year]] and becoming just the fourth woman to win the award with a solo composition. Perry was also nominated for the [[Grammy Award for Best Country Song]] at the [[53rd Grammy Awards]], while The Band Perry won New Vocal Duo/Group and Top New Artist at the 2011 [[Academy of Country Music Awards]]. Additional singles from their self-titled debut included "[[You Lie (The Band Perry song)|You Lie]]", which reached number two, "[[All Your Life]]", which became the group's second number one, and "[[Postcard from Paris]]", which reached number six. Beginning in 2012, The Band Perry started working on their follow-up album, releasing the lead single "[[Better Dig Two]]" on October 29 of that year. The song became their third number one and was certified 2x platinum.{{cite news |title=June 5, 2013: Florida Georgia Line, Danielle Bradbery, Blake Shelton, Cole Swindell Lead |url=http://www.roughstock.com/blog/june-5-2013-florida-georgia-line-danielle-bradbery-blake-shelton-cole-swindell-lead |last=Bjorke |first=Matt |work=Roughstock |date=2013-06-05 |accessdate=June 6, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130919204224/http://www.roughstock.com/blog/june-5-2013-florida-georgia-line-danielle-bradbery-blake-shelton-cole-swindell-lead |archivedate=September 19, 2013 }} The second single, "[[Done (The Band Perry song)|Done]]", was released in March 2013, with the album, ''[[Pioneer (The Band Perry album)|Pioneer]]'' being released on April 2, 2013 and becoming their first number one album on the [[Top Country Albums]] chart. The album also featured the top ten singles "[[Don't Let Me Be Lonely]]" and "[[Chainsaw (The Band Perry song)|Chainsaw]]". The Band Perry won Top Vocal Group at the 2013 [[Academy of Country Music Awards]] based on the strength of the album. In 2014, they recorded a cover of "[[Gentle on My Mind]]" for the documentary ''[[Glen Campbell: I'll Be Me]]'', which won them the [[Grammy Award for Best Country Duo/Group Performance]] in 2015.{{cite news|author=Colurso, Mary|date=January 13, 2015|title=Grammys 2015: The Band Perry wins for country duo/group performance, besting Little Big Town|url=https://www.al.com/entertainment/2015/02/the_band_perry_wins_2015_gramm.html|work=[[Advance Publications|Advance Local Media]]|accessdate=September 28, 2021}} On August 14, 2015, the band released "[[Live Forever (The Band Perry song)|Live Forever]]" off their planned third studio album and subsequently signed with [[Interscope Records]] with the plan to release more pop-oriented material. They released several singles, including "[[Comeback Kid (The Band Perry song)|Comeback Kid]]" and "[[Stay in the Dark]]" on Interscope to limited success and a third album, tentatively titled ''Heart + Beat'' and later ''My Bad Imagination'', never materialized and they left the label in mid-2018. The group self-released a five track extended play in September 2018 titled ''Coordinates''.{{cite news |url=https://www.greenevillesun.com/news/local_news/kimberly-perry-goes-solo-announces-pregnancy/article_a1449be0-eacd-11ed-bb94-8bf610772ab4.html |title=Kimberly Perry Goes Solo, Announces Pregnancy |first=Lisa |last=Warren |date=May 5, 2023 |work=[[The Greeneville Sun]] |access-date=May 17, 2023}} ===Solo career=== The Band Perry announced that they were officially going on hiatus on March 27, 2023 to focus on solo projects.{{Cite web |url=https://people.com/country/the-band-perry-announces-hiatus-to-focus-on-individual-creative-pursuits |title=The Band Perry Announces Hiatus and Says Members Will Focus on 'Individual Creative Pursuits' |last=Irwin |first=Jack |magazine=People |date=March 27, 2023 |access-date=March 27, 2023 |language=en}} Kimberly was the first to reveal plans and signed with RECORDS, a subsidiary of [[Columbia Records|Columbia]] to release her debut solo single "[[If I Die Young Pt. 2]]" on May 5, 2023, the first track from ''Bloom'', an extended play which was released on June 9. In an interview with [[Rolling Stone]], Perry stated that she was hoping to have her debut solo album completed by the fall of 2023.{{cite magazine |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-features/kimberly-perry-why-band-perry-broke-up-bloom-1234766321/|title=Kimberly Perry on The Band Perry's Breakup: 'Did We Leave or Were We Kicked Out?'|first=Marissa |last=Moss |date=June 8, 2023 |magazine=[[Rolling Stone]] |access-date=June 9, 2023}} A longer version of the ''Bloom'' EP, titled ''Superbloom'', was released on October 27, including several new songs, such as "Fool's Gold", "Black Corvette", and "Monsters".{{Cite web |last=Major |first=Michael |title=Grammy Award-Winner Kimberly Perry Releases 'Superbloom' Extended EP |url=https://www.broadwayworld.com/bwwmusic/article/Grammy-Award-Winner-Kimberly-Perry-Releases-Superbloom-Extended-EP-20231027 |access-date=2023-10-27 |website=BroadwayWorld.com |language=en}} ==Personal life== Perry announced her engagement to [[Toronto Blue Jays]] catcher [[J. P. Arencibia]] on September 30, 2013, and married him in [[Greeneville, Tennessee]], on June 12, 2014.{{Cite web |url=http://tasteofcountry.com/kimberly-perry-engaged/ |title=Kimberly Perry of the Band Perry Engaged |last=Dukes |first=Billy |date=1 October 2013 |website=Taste of Country |access-date=11 February 2017}}{{cite news|last=Watts|first=Cindy|date=June 12, 2014|title=Kimberly Perry weds baseball pro J.P. Arencibia |url=http://www.tennessean.com/story/entertainment/music/2014/06/12/kimberly-perry-weds/10402725/|newspaper=The Tennessean|access-date=June 12, 2014}} The pair divorced in March 2018.{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/918217/the-band-perry-s-kimberly-perry-files-for-divorce-from-j-p-arencibia|title=The Band Perry's Kimberly Perry Files for Divorce From J.P. Arencibia|last=Vulpo|first=Mike|work=[[E!]]|date=March 4, 2018|access-date=March 6, 2018}} Perry married Johnny Costello in June 2021 and announced that the couple were expecting their first child in April 2023.{{Cite web |url=https://people.com/music/the-band-perry-kimberly-perry-secretly-married-johnny-costello/ |title=The Band Perry's Kimberly Perry Reveals She Secretly Married Johnny Costello in June: 'Wild and Wonderful' |last=Adams |first=Abigail |date=19 December 2021 |website=People |access-date=13 April 2023}}{{Cite web |url=https://tasteofcountry.com/kimberly-perry-pregnant/ |title=Kimberly Perry Is Expecting Her First Child with Husband Johnny Constello |last=Rose |first=Jess |date=13 April 2023 |website=Taste of Country |access-date=13 April 2023}} On June 1, Perry revealed that she had previously suffered a miscarriage prior to recording "If I Die Young Pt. 2".{{Cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/kimberly-perry-miscarriage/|title=Kimberly Perry Suffered a Miscarriage Before Recording 'If I Die Young Pt. 2â€²|last=Liptak|first=Carena|website=[[Taste Of Country]]|date=June 2023 |language=en-US|access-date=2023-06-09}} ==Discography== {{Main|The Band Perry discography}} ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+Extended play, with selected details !
